column4: check gnome-system-monitor to see if anything is hogging resources
how do I check the gnome-system-monitor? I run xfce.
run gnome-system-monitor in a terminal and see whats eating up memory and/or cpu
thank you. is there any way I can copy all text in top?
when in top, hit F then n then return
oh my gosh. you got your own company?
run "cat /var/log/syslog | grep usb" and see what it gives you
it should be... bad things do happen.. you need to learn some tricks
ctrl alt backspace kills the x-server
ctrtl alt f1 switches to console
